objects.name: Directions
objects.string: Hold the left click to attract fishes.

events.comment: This scene shows how other objects or players can interact with Boids.
The "for each" is necessary because fishes may not be around the same jellyfish.
This scene shows how Boid configuration can change their behavior.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/), D8H
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: DraggableSliderControl
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: A draggable slider that users can move to select a numerical value.
description: Draws a draggable slider that users can move to select a numerical value.
The value range, tick spacing, and the appearance of the slider can be defined with properties.
- Add this behavior a **Shape Painter** object
- Place an instance of that shape painter on the screen where you want the slider to appear
- Use the "Value" expression to find the Value based on the position of the slider
- You can disable the slider to prevent a user from interacting with it
- You can set the Value of the slider and the slider will move to the correct position
Further details can be found in [this tutorial video](https://youtu.be/iiTUwdAT_hs).
- Track thickness and length properties replaced track width and height. These 2 properties must be set again if they were different from the default size.
- Hidden sliders can be dragged. The "enable" action must be used to disable them.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Let users select a numerical value by dragging a slider.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: DraggableSliderControl

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Tristan Rhodes (tristan@victrisgames.com), Entropy
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ScreenWrap
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Teleport objects leaving one side of the screen so that they immediately reappear on the opposite side, maintaining speed and trajectory.
description: By default, the borders of the wrapping area match the screen size, but they can be changed.
The teleport happens when the center of the object crosses a border. In the behavior properties, you can modify (increase or decrease) the margin used to trigger this teleport.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Teleport the object when leaving one side of the screen so that it immediately reappears on the opposite side, maintaining speed and trajectory.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: ScreenWrap

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: BoidsMovement
description: Simulates swarms or flocks movement following the separation, alignment, cohesion principles. The flock can be attracted to a location or avoid some obstacles.
The [Fish School example](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://fish-school) shows how properties impact on the movement.

eventsFunctions.description: Define JavaScript classes.
eventsFunctions.name: DefineJavaScript

inlineCode: * Adds a velocity to this vector
* @param {Vector} referenceVector gets the velocity to be added
* Subtracts vectors verticies from a reference vector
* Methods for Separation, Cohesion, Alignment added
* Inspired from The Nature of Code - Daniel Shiffman
* @param {Vector} vector the vector to return the result
* Applys the three rules of boids
* Apply the acceleration from the steer force.
* Calculates and applies steering force towards a direction
* Alignment: calculate the average velocity for every nearby boid in the system
* Cohesion: calculate direction vector towards the average location of all nearby boids
// A vector pointing from the position to the target
* Add a boid to the R-Tree.
* Remove a boid from the R-Tree.
* Returns all the boids around the specified boid.
* @return {Boid[]} An array with all boids near the object.
// TODO The R-Tree should not allocate an array.
// Cap the number of boids between 20 and 40.

eventsFunctions.name: AvoidPosition
eventsFunctions.sentence: _PARAM0_ intend to avoid a radius of _PARAM4_ around _PARAM2_; _PARAM3_ (decision weight: _PARAM5_)

events.comment:
Evaluate at which distance the object will go past a location if it were to continue in its current direction.

speedUnitX = velocityX / speed
speedUnitY = velocityY / speed

deltaX = centerX - object.CenterX
deltaY = centerY - object.CenterY

normalX = -deltaY;
normalY = deltaX;

trajectoryDistance = speedUnitX * normalX + speedUnitY * normalY
If this distance is smaller than the specified radius, the Boid must try turn in the right direction to avoid the area.
(normalX ; normalY)
(-normalX ; -normalY)
